questions.question: Determine the discharge through a pipe of diameter 24m and length 47m, when one end of the pipe is connected to a tank and other end is open to the atmosphere. The height of water level in the tank is 4m above the centre of the pipe. Consider all minor losses.

Determine the discharge through a pipe of diameter 25m and length 60m, when one end of the pipe is connected to a tank and other end is open to the atmosphere. The height of water level in the tank is 4m above the centre of the pipe. Consider all minor losses.
